name: Introduction to Archaeology
description: Introduction to the fundamentals of archaeological study, including excavation techniques, archaeological dating, and methods of analyzing artifacts.

name: Theory and Practice of Archaeology
description: This course examines archaeological theorizing and practice through a variety of case studies.

name: Archaeology of the Ancient Near East
description: This course covers the ancient civilizations of the Near East and their archaeological remains, including Assyria, Babylonia, Persia, and Sumer.

name: Ancient Egypt and the Mediterranean
description: This course covers the ancient civilizations of Egypt, Greece, and Rome, and their archaeological remains.

name: Archaeology of the Bible
description: This course covers the archaeological evidence of the Bible and its related cultures, including the civilizations of Canaan, Israel, Judah, and Philistia.
prerequisites: Archaeology of the Ancient Near East

name: Advanced Archaeology of the Bible
description: This course covers the advanced archaeological evidence of the Bible and its related cultures, including the civilizations of Canaan, Israel, Judah, and Philistia.
prerequisites: Archaeology of the Ancient Near East
